metadata.Title: CVE-2022-43552 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description: A use after free vulnerability exists in curl <7.87.0. Curl can be asked to*tunnel* virtually all protocols it supports through an HTTP proxy. HTTPproxies can (and often do) deny such tunnel operations. When getting deniedto tunnel the specific protocols SMB or TELNET, curl would use aheap-allocated struct after it had been freed, in its transfer shutdowncode path.

criterions.comment: curl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
